title: Regional Director, Singapore at Hays
summary:
Hays plc (the Group) is a leading global professional recruiting group. The Group is the expert at recruiting qualified, professional and skilled people worldwide, being the market leader in the UK and Australia and one of the market leaders in Continental Europe, Latin America and Asia. The Group operates across the private and public sectors, dealing in permanent positions, contract roles and temporary assignments.  

Email

education.degree: Postgraduate Certificate in International Development, Development Economics and International Development
Bachelor of Arts (B.A.), International Relations and Affairs
education.school: University of Canterbury, Christchurch, New Zealand

experience.description: Our Singapore business operates across 13 sectors specialising in both permanent & flexible staffing solutions. As the Country Manager, I am responsible for the P&L and strategic direction of the region focusing on delivering an excellent service to our customers & the development of our people. We are in an exciting new phase of growth and actively expanding our footprint across both the SME & MNC markets, with 38% fee growth in FY22 and over 100 employees in our business. We are market leaders in technology recruitment with 25 consultants covering both permanent & contract roles, specialised in software development, cyber, cloud, infrastructure, UXUI, data science and technology sales.

Transferred to China in 2016 and was promoted to lead our Guangzhou office in 2017. Returned the business to growth within the first year and developed an outstanding local leadership team, enabling us to build scale in core markets and establish several large anchor clients. Promoted to Business Director in 2018 and then into an expanded regional role leading our two offices in South China. In 2019, Guangzhou achieved a record breaking year with 40% fee growth (#1 growth office for Hays Asia) & achieved profit targets. After successful incubation from GZ, we doubled our team size in Shenzhen & moved into brand new premises.  Enjoyed a career break with family Oct-Dec 2020.South China Offices

Transferred internally to lead a team of temp & perm consultants across multiple SBUs in our Corporate division, including Banking & FS, Insurance, Contact Centres and Sales & Marketing. Specialised personally in senior appointments at regional & executive level. By FY15, had returned the business to growth achieving strong YOY results in Banking (69%+) and Sales & Marketing (30%+). Emerged as the preferred vendor in WA for several major national accounts. Ranked #1 Top Perm Biller in the Perth office for 2015 and placed 3rd highest biller in Australasia for Banking perm.
experience.position: Manager - Banking, Insurance, Contact Centres, Sales & Marketing

experience.company: European Union Chamber of Commerce in China
experience.description: The European Chamber has 1,600 members in 7 chapters across 9 cities in China and is the peak body for advocacy & market expertise for European MNCs and SMEs doing business in China. I was elected to the board in an advisory capacity for matters related to hiring & market tends regularly sharing key content at various seminars/ large scale events. For all membership enquiries, contact the GM via email

The Australian Chamber of Commerce in South China provided advocacy services primarily for SME businesses operating in the region. I was elected to the board in an advisory capacity & also worked as part of the GBA committee.

Managed the mobilisation & onboarding of new hires into Gove, NT for Rio Tinto Alcan. End-to-end management of relocation services, including policy consulting and development, expense forecasting and management together with administration and destination services.

Coordination of IT service for contracted corporate accounts. Client interface for 1st level desktop support and coordination of system engineers, management of proactive maintenance schedule and SLR reporting.
